main event: A cigar-shaped object with revolving lights around its exhaust was observed over Keflavik International Airport in Iceland.
interesting points: The object was reported to have a bright, flaming exhaust that was about five times the size of the principal object.
The object maintained a straight, level course and did not appear to burn out as quickly as a typical meteor.
Multiple military witnesses, including a Navy petty officer and an Air Force airman, observed the object and reported it to have high reliability.
The object was also observed by the crew of a Pan Am 727 flight, who reported seeing a fiery-tailed object at a much higher altitude.
The preparing officer concluded that the object was likely a comet, satellite, or meteor, based on the altitude, suggested speed, and general appearance.
result: The sighting was concluded to likely be a comet, satellite, or meteor, but was not definitively identified.
sighted object: A cigar-shaped object with revolving lights around its exhaust
witnesses: Military personnel and a commercial airline crew
photographs: No photographs were included in the report.
